DataElement.preferredDefinition: The words that describe a particular kind of immunogen.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The description of the antigen or epitope that is capable of evoking an immune response.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An active power or cause (as principle, substance, physical or biological factor, etc.) that produces a specific effect. (NCI):A technique used to cause an immune response that results in resistance to a specific disease, especially an infectious disease.

Concepts.definition: An active power or cause (as principle, substance, physical or biological factor, etc.) that produces a specific effect.
Inoculating an individual with either killed or live agents to prevent contraction of a disease.

Property.preferredDefinition: A statement or an account describing something.

Concepts.definition: A written or verbal account, representation, statement, or explanation of something.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: A category of organic or inorganic substances, elements, and isotopes used in research or for the prevention, diagnosis, and/or treatment of disease states. Includes biologically active substances that are either synthetically manufactured or endogenous substances extracted and processed to be reintroduced into an organism. Chemicals and drugs also include hazardous substances, and naturally occurring or synthetically produced substances required to maintain life.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The words that describe a particular immunogen.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A compound of two or more amino acids where the alpha carboxyl group of one is bound to the alpha amino group of another.

Concepts.definition: A compound of two or more amino acids where the alpha carboxyl group of one is bound to the alpha amino group of another.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The simplest form of an antigenic determinant, on a complex antigenic molecule, which can combine with antibody or T cell receptor.

Concepts.definition: The simplest form of an antigenic determinant, on a complex antigenic molecule, which can combine with antibody or T cell receptor.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Any substance that appears foreign or potentially adverse to the body and elicits immune response.

Concepts.definition: Any substance, generally a protein, that stimulates the immune system and elicits an immune response.  Recognition by the immune system elicits either a T-lymphocyte response, recognizing processed antigens, or a B-lymphocyte response, producing antibodies that bind to unprocessed antigens.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: A category of organic or inorganic substances, elements, and isotopes used in research or for the prevention, diagnosis, and/or treatment of disease states. Includes biologically active substances that are either synthetically manufactured or endogenous substances extracted and processed to be reintroduced into an organism. Chemicals and drugs also include hazardous substances, and naturally occurring or synthetically produced substances required to maintain life.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A sub-field of genetics that uses both genetic and immunological analyses to study the genetics behind antibody formation and the immune response. (Biotech Life Science Dictionary):Description; a statement that represents something in words.:Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: A sub-field of genetics that uses both genetic and immunological analyses to study the genetics behind antibody formation and the immune response. (Biotech Life Science Dictionary)
A written or verbal account, representation, statement, or explanation of something.
Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ClassificationSchemes.longName: DCTD (Division of Cancer Treatment and Diagnosis)
